oracle.adf.view.rich.render

Enum TransitionType

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<TransitionType>
      • oracle.adf.view.rich.render.TransitionType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<TransitionType>

    public enum TransitionType
extends Enum<TransitionType>
    The name of the transition for a trigger type. The actual animation may vary from what is described here.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      AUTO
      Leave the decision up to the parent component.
      FADE
      A gradual opacity change between the views.
      FLIP_DOWN
      Imagine the 2 views sandwiched, the top of the sandwich moves toward the user and continues downward until the sandwich is flipped a full 180 degrees.
      FLIP_END
      Imagine the 2 views sandwiched, the start of the sandwich moves toward the user and continues in the end direction until the sandwich is flipped a full 180 degrees.
      FLIP_LEFT
      Imagine the 2 views sandwiched, the right of the sandwich moves toward the user and continues in the left direction until the sandwich is flipped a full 180 degrees.
      FLIP_RIGHT
      Imagine the 2 views sandwiched, the left of the sandwich moves toward the user and continues in the right direction until the sandwich is flipped a full 180 degrees.
      FLIP_START
      Imagine the 2 views sandwiched, the end of the sandwich moves toward the user and continues in the start direction until the sandwich is flipped a full 180 degrees.
      FLIP_UP
      Imagine the 2 views sandwiched, the bottom of the sandwich moves toward the user and continues upward until the sandwich is flipped a full 180 degrees.
      HORIZONTAL
      Imagine the view moves in the horizontal direction.
      NONE
      No animation between views; the default and also the type used if another specified animation type is not supported on a platform.
      SLIDE_DOWN
      Imagine the 2 views stacked vertically, they both move down.
      SLIDE_END
      Imagine the 2 views stacked horizontally, they both move in the end direction.
      SLIDE_LEFT
      Imagine the 2 views stacked horizontally, they both move in the left direction.
      SLIDE_RIGHT
      Imagine the 2 views stacked horizontally, they both move in the right direction.
      SLIDE_START
      Imagine the 2 views stacked horizontally, they both move in the start direction.
      SLIDE_UP
      Imagine the 2 views stacked vertically, they both move up.
      VERTICAL
      Imagine the view moves in the vertical direction.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • NONE

        public static final TransitionType NONE
        No animation between views; the default and also the type used if another specified animation type is not supported on a platform.

      • AUTO

        public static final TransitionType AUTO
        Leave the decision up to the parent component.

      • FADE

        public static final TransitionType FADE
        A gradual opacity change between the views.

      • FLIP_UP

        public static final TransitionType FLIP_UP
        Imagine the 2 views sandwiched, the bottom of the sandwich moves toward the user and continues upward until the sandwich is flipped a full 180 degrees.

      • FLIP_DOWN

        public static final TransitionType FLIP_DOWN
        Imagine the 2 views sandwiched, the top of the sandwich moves toward the user and continues downward until the sandwich is flipped a full 180 degrees.

      • FLIP_START

        public static final TransitionType FLIP_START
        Imagine the 2 views sandwiched, the end of the sandwich moves toward the user and continues in the start direction until the sandwich is flipped a full 180 degrees.

      • FLIP_END

        public static final TransitionType FLIP_END
        Imagine the 2 views sandwiched, the start of the sandwich moves toward the user and continues in the end direction until the sandwich is flipped a full 180 degrees.

      • FLIP_LEFT

        public static final TransitionType FLIP_LEFT
        Imagine the 2 views sandwiched, the right of the sandwich moves toward the user and continues in the left direction until the sandwich is flipped a full 180 degrees.

      • FLIP_RIGHT

        public static final TransitionType FLIP_RIGHT
        Imagine the 2 views sandwiched, the left of the sandwich moves toward the user and continues in the right direction until the sandwich is flipped a full 180 degrees.

      • SLIDE_UP

        public static final TransitionType SLIDE_UP
        Imagine the 2 views stacked vertically, they both move up.

      • SLIDE_DOWN

        public static final TransitionType SLIDE_DOWN
        Imagine the 2 views stacked vertically, they both move down.

      • SLIDE_START

        public static final TransitionType SLIDE_START
        Imagine the 2 views stacked horizontally, they both move in the start direction.

      • SLIDE_END

        public static final TransitionType SLIDE_END
        Imagine the 2 views stacked horizontally, they both move in the end direction.

      • SLIDE_LEFT

        public static final TransitionType SLIDE_LEFT
        Imagine the 2 views stacked horizontally, they both move in the left direction.

      • SLIDE_RIGHT

        public static final TransitionType SLIDE_RIGHT
        Imagine the 2 views stacked horizontally, they both move in the right direction.

      • VERTICAL

        public static final TransitionType VERTICAL
        Imagine the view moves in the vertical direction. The start and end direction of transition are decided by the component.

      • HORIZONTAL

        public static final TransitionType HORIZONTAL
        Imagine the view moves in the horizontal direction. The start and end direction of transition are decided by the component.
